newsitem.title: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO: UNHCR resumes repatriation of Rwandans from Congo.
newsitem.headline: UNHCR resumes repatriation of Rwandans from Congo.

text.p: The United Nations refugee agency UNHCR said on Saturday it had resumed the voluntary repatriation of Rwandan Hutu refugees from the upper reaches of the Congo river.
"We've resumed our flights," said Bernard Kerblat, UNHCR's emergency response team leader.
The first plane left Kinshasa early on Saturday to Lukolela, 450 km (280 miles) north of Brazzaville in Congo Republic and flew 85 refugees to Kigali, he added.
The agency plans to operate one such flight daily.

Saturday's was the 15th such flight and follows the evacuation of 1,100 other refugees. The repatriation was interrupted last month because of the security situation in Congo after political violence broke out in Brazzaville.

The refugees, among them some responsible for the 1994 genocide of an estimated 800,000 Tutsis and moderate Hutus in Rwanda, fled from camps in what was eastern Zaire ahead of the advance of Laurent Kabila's rebels, who went on to seize power in Kinshasa in May.
When the rebels arrived in Mbandaka on the Zairean bank of the river Congo, the refugees crossed into Congo Republic.
